subject: Re: [junit] JUnitCore.runClasses and @RunWith
msgSnippet: JUnitCore.runClasses does not attach the console listener, but does return a valid Result.  If you want the console listener, you ll need to copy the sequence
messageBody:
JUnitCore.runClasses does not attach the console listener, but does
return a valid Result. If you want the console listener, you'll need
to copy the sequence from JUnitCore.main.

David Saff

On Mon, Aug 10, 2009 at 4:55 PM, Johannes Link<jl@...> wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I always assumed that JUnitCore.runClasses(...) could also run classes annotated with @RunWith. Was this assumption wrong? It does not seem to work with ClasspathSuite nor with Suite (tested with JUnit 4.6). At least, I don't see any console output. Should I?
>
> confused...
>
> Johannes
